[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Struct: InterpreterFunctionCaches] [Panic recovery] If a validator panics during cache operation, can partially-committed cache state cause incorrect behavior when execution is retried? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_non_generic()] [Loader invariant violation] The code assumes FunctionPtr::from_loaded_function() produces stable pointer identity per the loader guarantee - if the loader violates this by creating multiple Arc<Function> for the same function, can duplicate cache entries cause memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_generic()] [TypeVecId collision] If the loader's TypeVecId generation has bugs allowing collisions for different type vectors, can two incompatible generic instantiations share the same GenericFunctionPtr and corrupt each other's caches? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache()] [LoadedFunction invariant] If a LoadedFunction has inconsistent ty_args state (non-empty vector but ty_args_id=0 or vice versa), can the cache routing logic malfunction and cause type confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Struct: InterpreterFunctionCaches] [Module unloading] If a module containing a cached function is unloaded, can dangling FunctionPtr keys remain in the cache, pointing to freed memory? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Struct: InterpreterFunctionCaches] [Transaction isolation] If the same InterpreterFunctionCaches instance is reused across multiple transactions, can cache state from an aborted/failed transaction contaminate subsequent transaction execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: new()] [Cache lifetime] Since new() creates empty caches, is there proper cleanup between transactions? Can FrameTypeCache entries leak data from one transaction to another, violating transaction isolation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_non_generic()] [State leakage] Can cached FrameTypeCache internal state (BTreeMaps) retain information from previous transaction's type instantiations, leaking private data across transaction boundaries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Struct: InterpreterFunctionCaches] [Speculative execution] During Block-STM speculative execution, if a transaction is later aborted, are its cache modifications rolled back? Can speculative cache state persist and affect other transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_non_generic()] [Malformed bytecode] If LoadedFunction points to malformed or unverified bytecode, can FrameTypeCache::make_rc_for_function() create a cache with incorrect size, causing out-of-bounds access during execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_generic()] [Type parameter validation] Is there validation that LoadedFunction.ty_args matches the function's declared type parameters? Can mismatched type arguments create invalid GenericFunctionPtr keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache()] [Verification bypass] Can an attacker craft bytecode that bypasses Move's verifier but exploits cache logic to skip runtime type checks by reusing caches from verified functions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_non_generic()] [Recursive caching] Can recursive function calls create circular references in Rc<RefCell<FrameTypeCache>>, causing memory leaks or stack overflow when the cache is accessed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_generic()] [Type parameter limit] Is there a maximum limit on the number of type parameters? Can an attacker create generic functions with excessive type parameters to make TypeVecId overflow or cause hash collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Struct: InterpreterFunctionCaches] [Clone cost] When .clone() is called on Rc<RefCell<FrameTypeCache>>, only the reference count increments - but can this shared ownership lead to unexpected lifetime extension where caches persist longer than intended? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache()] [Branch prediction] Can an attacker train the ty_args.is_empty() branch predictor by alternating between generic and non-generic calls to create timing side-channels that leak information about other transactions? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_non_generic()] [Entry API race] Can the HashMap entry() API on line 49 expose a TOCTOU vulnerability where the function pointer is valid during entry() but invalidated before or_insert_with() executes? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_generic()] [Compound key vulnerability] Since GenericFunctionPtr is (FunctionPtr, TypeVecId), can manipulating one component while keeping the other constant create unexpected cache interactions? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Struct: InterpreterFunctionCaches] [Memory ordering] Without explicit synchronization primitives, can cache reads/writes be reordered by the CPU, causing incorrect cache state observation in optimized builds? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache_generic()] [Type erasure] After generic monomorphization, can different source-level generic functions compile to identical FunctionPtr but different TypeVecId, causing cache fragmentation and memory waste? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Struct: InterpreterFunctionCaches] [Cache warming] Can an attacker 'warm' the cache with malicious entries before legitimate transactions execute, causing them to use poisoned caches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: new()] [Initialization safety] Since new() only initializes empty HashMaps, can uninitialized memory be accidentally exposed if the struct is constructed through other means (mem::zeroed, etc.)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/interpreter_caches.rs] [Function: get_or_create_frame_cache()] [Call graph] In complex call graphs with mutual recursion between generic and non-generic functions, can cache state become inconsistent across the call stack? (Medium)
